I think this is the better of the two episodes following Half-Life 2. In terms of setpieces and story events, it's got a long more going on than in Episode One. You've escaped City 17 just as the Citadel explodes, creating a portal that would eventually grow into a superportal to the Combine home world, in another universe. It's now up to Gordon, Alyx, and the Resistance at White Forest base to deliver a payload into the upper atmosphere that would abort the portal and effectively isolate the Combine forces on Earth. Nobody on their side goes home, and no one else comes through. It's just you and them. That is, unless they reach what had been discovered by Mossman and her team at the Northern base. It's funny to think that it's been almost 15 years since we'd been left hanging at the finale of this game until Half-Life: Alyx. Now, thankfully, we've got reason to not only look back fondly at our time and memories of these games, but also look ahead to what comes next.

Las partes en las que vas en coche son muy divertidas.
Empatizas con los personajes del juego. Y la historia esta muy bien contada. 
Cuanto mas te fijas en los detalles del juego m√°s te gusta.

The game is good so far! I'm about to leave in the helicopter with Eli and Alyx, I can't wait for the ending!

Clearly the superior Episode, it continues the last part pretty damn well, gameplay is back to being fun where Episode 1 felt a little too experimental to the point of irritation, Episode 2 feels more true to Half-Life's core design. The final fight can be pretty.... a lot, but that's really my only issue with the game, the rest of it is pretty great
